titleStmt.title: Unum necessarium, or, The great duty of a Christian in two tracts : the one, Of adhering to God, written in Latin, by Albertus Magnus, the other, Of the love of God, written in high- Dutch, by John Staupitz / both faithfully translated into English for the promoting of primitive Christianity.
De adhaerendo Deo. English. 1692
titleStmt.author: Albertus, Magnus, Saint, 1193?-1280.

titleStmt.title: Unum necessarium, or, The great duty of a Christian in two tracts : the one, Of adhering to God, written in Latin, by Albertus Magnus, the other, Of the love of God, written in high- Dutch, by John Staupitz / both faithfully translated into English for the promoting of primitive Christianity.
De adhaerendo Deo. English. 1692
titleStmt.author: Albertus, Magnus, Saint, 1193?-1280.
Johannes von Kastl, 15th cent.
Staupitz, Johann von, d. 1524.

notesStmt.note: De adhaerendo Deo has also been attributed to Johannes von Kastl.
Imperfect: stained and tightly bound, with loss of text.

Second part has continuous paging and special t.p.: Two ancient spiritual treatises of Dr. John Staupitz, Abbot of St. Peters at Saltsburg in Germany, concerning the sweet love of God, and our holy Christian faith.
Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
